segment.source: What's new in Trusted Platform Module (Windows 10)
segment.target: What's new in Trusted Platform Module (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes new features for the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) in Windows 10.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes new features for the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) in Windows 10.

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes new features for the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) in Windows 10.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes new features for the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) in Windows 10.

segment.source: New features in Windows 10, version 1511
segment.target: New features in Windows 10, version 1511

segment.source: Key Storage Providers (KSPs) and srvcrypt support elliptical curve cryptography (ECC).
segment.target: Key Storage Providers (KSPs) and srvcrypt support elliptical curve cryptography (ECC).

segment.source: New features in Windows 10
segment.target: New features in Windows 10

segment.source: The following sections describe the new and changed functionality in the TPM for Windows 10:
segment.target: The following sections describe the new and changed functionality in the TPM for Windows 10:

segment.source: Device health attestation
segment.target: Device health attestation

segment.source: Microsoft Passport support
segment.target: Microsoft Passport support

segment.source: Device Guard support
segment.target: Device Guard support

segment.source: Credential Guard support
segment.target: Credential Guard support

segment.source: Device health attestation
segment.target: Device health attestation

segment.source: Device health attestation enables enterprises to establish trust based on hardware and software components of a managed device.
segment.target: Device health attestation enables enterprises to establish trust based on hardware and software components of a managed device.

segment.source: With device heath attestation, you can configure an MDM server to query a health attestation service that will allow or deny a managed device access to a secure resource.
segment.target: With device heath attestation, you can configure an MDM server to query a health attestation service that will allow or deny a managed device access to a secure resource.

segment.source: Some things that you can check on the device are:
segment.target: Some things that you can check on the device are:

segment.source: Is Data Execution Prevention supported and enabled?
segment.target: Is Data Execution Prevention supported and enabled?

segment.source: Is BitLocker Drive Encryption supported and enabled?
segment.target: Is BitLocker Drive Encryption supported and enabled?

segment.source: Is SecureBoot supported and enabled?
segment.target: Is SecureBoot supported and enabled?

segment.source: Note The device must be running Windows 10 and it must support at least TPM 2.0.
segment.target: Note The device must be running Windows 10 and it must support at least TPM 2.0.

segment.source: Learn how to deploy and manage TPM within your organization.
segment.target: Learn how to deploy and manage TPM within your organization.
